questions.question: I always feel ............................... in the afternoon.
questions.description: Feel is a copular verb. We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: I .............................. her till twelve, and then went home.
questions.description: Before an object, we use wait for.

questions.question: They talk such ...............................!
questions.description: Nonsense is uncountable. It cannot be used with a.

questions.question: Every one of the guests .............................. dancing.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every one.

questions.question: I go there every ...............................
questions.description: Every should be followed by a singular noun.

questions.question: I see her every few ..................................
questions.description: Every is used with plural nouns in expressions that refer to intervals.

questions.question: I enjoy ............................... in the rain.
questions.description: Enjoy is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: It was Sam ............................... bought the tickets.
questions.description: That cannot be used to refer to people in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: She looks ........................... older than she used to.
questions.description: Very cannot be used with comparatives.

questions.question: We ................................ meet in the cafeteria in the evenings.
questions.description: Either would or used to can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: Let's meet ............................... next week.
questions.description: Sometime refers to an indefinite time in future.
